  • Interfaces 
    Interface Description
    io.servicetalk.client.api.AutoRetryStrategyProvider
    The capabilities of the auto-retry have been introduced under a new universal retrying filter, available from io.servicetalk.http.netty.RetryingHttpRequesterFilter.
    io.servicetalk.client.api.internal.ServiceDiscovererUtils.TwoIntsConsumer
    This interface is defined by an internal class and will be removed in a future release. If you depend on it, consider replicating it.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.AsyncContextMap
    Use ContextMap.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.AsyncContextMapHolder
    Use ContextMapHolder.
    io.servicetalk.encoding.api.ContentCodecBuilder
    encoding-api based solution is being replaced with a netty implementation available under servicetalk-encoding-netty dependency.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.FilterableGrpcClient
    gRPC Client Filters will be removed in future release of ServiceTalk. We encourage the use of StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory and if the access to the decoded payload is necessary, then performing that logic can be done in the particular client implementation. Please use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter( io.servicetalk.http.api.StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) upon the builder obtained using GrpcClientBuilder.initializeHttp(GrpcClientBuilder.HttpInitializer) if HTTP filters are acceptable in your use case.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientBuilder.MultiClientBuilder
    Use GrpcClientFactory.newClient(GrpcClientCallFactory) or GrpcClientFactory.newBlockingClient(GrpcClientCallFactory) and provide a custom GrpcClientCallFactory instead.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientFilterFactory
    gRPC Client Filters will be removed in future release of ServiceTalk. We encourage the use of StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory and if the access to the decoded payload is necessary, then performing that logic can be done in the particular client implementation. Please use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter( io.servicetalk.http.api.StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) upon the builder obtained using GrpcClientBuilder.initializeHttp(GrpcClientBuilder.HttpInitializer) if HTTP filters are acceptable in your use case.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientSecurityConfigurator
    Use GrpcClientBuilder.sslConfig(ClientSslConfig).
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcServerSecurityConfigurator
    Use GrpcServerBuilder.sslConfig(ServerSslConfig).
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcServiceFilterFactory
    gRPC Service Filters will be removed in future release of ServiceTalk. We encourage the use of StreamingHttpServiceFilterFactory and if the access to the decoded payload is necessary, then performing that logic can be done in the particular service implementation. Please use HttpServerBuilder.appendServiceFilter(StreamingHttpServiceFilterFactory) upon the builder obtained using GrpcServerBuilder.initializeHttp(GrpcServerBuilder.HttpInitializer) if HTTP filters are acceptable in your use case.
    io.servicetalk.http.api.HttpServerSecurityConfigurator
    Use HttpServerBuilder.sslConfig(ServerSslConfig).
    io.servicetalk.http.api.MultiAddressHttpClientFilterFactory
    Use MultiAddressHttpClientBuilder.initializer(MultiAddressHttpClientBuilder.SingleAddressInitializer) and SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter(StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) or SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter(Predicate, StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) on the last argument of MultiAddressHttpClientBuilder.SingleAddressInitializer.initialize( String, Object, SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder).
    io.servicetalk.http.api.PartitionedHttpClientSecurityConfigurator
    Use PartitionedHttpClientBuilder.appendClientBuilderFilter(PartitionHttpClientBuilderConfigurator).
    io.servicetalk.http.api.PartitionHttpClientBuilderConfigurator
    Use PartitionedHttpClientBuilder.SingleAddressInitializer.
    io.servicetalk.http.api.ServiceDiscoveryRetryStrategy
    Use HttpClientBuilder.retryServiceDiscoveryErrors(BiIntFunction) or HttpClientBuilder.retryServiceDiscoveryErrors(BiIntFunction) combined with common utilities from RetryStrategies or provide your own retry strategy.
    io.servicetalk.http.api.SingleAddressHttpClientSecurityConfigurator
    Use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.sslConfig(ClientSslConfig).
    io.servicetalk.opentracing.inmemory.api.InMemoryTraceState
    This class will be removed in a follow up release. Alternative accessors will be available through the InMemorySpanContext API.
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ClientSecurityConfigurator
    Use ClientSslConfigBuilder.
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.SecurityConfigurator
    Use ServerSslConfigBuilder or ClientSslConfigBuilder.
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ServerSecurityConfigurator
    Use ServerSslConfigBuilder.

    Class Description
    io.servicetalk.client.api.AbstractRetryingFilterBuilder
    Moving forward ServiceTalk will remove this abstraction. Please rely on the protocol specific filter, like io.servicetalk.http.netty.RetryingHttpRequesterFilter.

    Moving forward ServiceTalk will remove this abstraction. Please rely on the protocol specific filter, like io.servicetalk.http.netty.RetryingHttpRequesterFilter

    The capabilities of the auto-retry have been introduced under a new universal retrying filter, available from io.servicetalk.http.netty.RetryingHttpRequesterFilter.

    This is an internal class and will be removed in a future release. If you depend on it, consider replicating its logic.

    Use ContextMap.Key with ContextMap.

    Use TestCompletable instead.

    io.servicetalk.encoding.api.ContentCodings
    API replaced by io.servicetalk.encoding.netty.ContentCodings
    io.servicetalk.http.api.DefaultServiceDiscoveryRetryStrategy
    Use HttpClientBuilder.retryServiceDiscoveryErrors(BiIntFunction) or HttpClientBuilder.retryServiceDiscoveryErrors(BiIntFunction) combined with common utilities from RetryStrategies or provide your own retry strategy.
    io.servicetalk.http.api.DefaultServiceDiscoveryRetryStrategy.Builder
    Use standard mechanisms for retrying using RetryStrategies combined with HttpClientBuilder.retryServiceDiscoveryErrors(BiIntFunction).
    io.servicetalk.http.utils.RetryingHttpRequesterFilter
    A replacement retrying http filter is available through io.servicetalk.http.netty.RetryingHttpRequesterFilter
    io.servicetalk.http.utils.RetryingHttpRequesterFilter.Builder
    A replacement retrying http filter builder is available through io.servicetalk.http.netty.RetryingHttpRequesterFilterBuilder
    io.servicetalk.loadbalancer.RoundRobinLoadBalancer
    Use RoundRobinLoadBalancerFactory to provide instances of this LoadBalancer. This class will become package-private in the future.
    io.servicetalk.loadbalancer.RoundRobinLoadBalancer.RoundRobinLoadBalancerFactory
    Use RoundRobinLoadBalancerFactory to build instances of this LoadBalancer
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.ClientSecurityConfig
    Use ClientSslConfig.
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.IoThreadFactory
    Use NettyIoThreadFactory.
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.ReadOnlyClientSecurityConfig
    Use ClientSslConfig.
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.ReadOnlyServerSecurityConfig
    Use ServerSslConfig.
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.ServerSecurityConfig
    Use ServerSslConfig.

  • Exceptions 
    Exceptions Description
    io.servicetalk.client.api.ConnectionClosedException
    There is no code that can throw this exception. We will remove it and create a new exception type if there is a use-case in future releases.

    There is no code that can throw this exception. We will remove it and create a new exception type if there is a use-case in future releases.

    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Completable.idleTimeout​(long, TimeUnit)
    Use Completable.timeout(long, TimeUnit).
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Completable.publishAndSubscribeOn​(Executor)
    This operator has been deprecated because of upcoming behavior changes in how offloading via operators is done. Originally offloading for subscribe/subscription was applied at the "bottom" of chain (logically the last operator in the chain closest to the subscriber), and offloading for subscriber was applied at the "top" of the operator chain (logically the first operator in the chain after the async source). The current offloading doesn't respect the order in which the operators are applied, the offloading is the same regardless of where the operators are placed in the chain. However, this behavior will soon change to instead respect operator placement order and apply offloading exactly where the offloading operators are applied in the chain. This change in behavior means that it no longer makes sense to fuse the offloading of publish and subscribe as the location of the operators in the chain will now be significant. Publish and subscribe offloading, when required, will typically be placed in different locations. Use separate, appropriately placed, Completable.subscribeOn(Executor) and Completable.publishOn(Executor) operators instead.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Completable.publishAndSubscribeOnOverride​(Executor)
    This method will be removed in a future release. Consider switching to Completable.publishAndSubscribeOn(Executor) and/or using Executor.execute(Runnable) for offloading.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Completable.publishOnOverride​(Executor)
    This method will be removed in a future release. Consider switching to Completable.publishOn(Executor) and/or using Executor.execute(Runnable) for offloading.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Completable.subscribeOnOverride​(Executor)
    This method will be removed in a future release. Consider switching to Completable.subscribeOn(Executor) and/or using Executor.execute(Runnable) for offloading.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Publisher.idleTimeout​(long, TimeUnit)
    Use Publisher.timeout(long, TimeUnit).
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Publisher.publishAndSubscribeOn​(Executor)
    This operator has been deprecated because of upcoming behavior changes in how offloading via operators is done. Originally offloading for subscribe/subscription was applied at the "bottom" of chain (logically the last operator in the chain closest to the subscriber), and offloading for subscriber was applied at the "top" of the operator chain (logically the first operator in the chain after the async source). The current offloading doesn't respect the order in which the operators are applied, the offloading is the same regardless of where the operators are placed in the chain. However, this behavior will soon change to instead respect operator placement order and apply offloading exactly where the offloading operators are applied in the chain. This change in behavior means that it no longer makes sense to fuse the offloading of publish and subscribe as the location of the operators in the chain will now be significant. Publish and subscribe offloading, when required, will typically be placed in different locations. Use separate, appropriately placed, Publisher.subscribeOn(Executor) and Publisher.publishOn(Executor) operators instead.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Publisher.publishAndSubscribeOnOverride​(Executor)
    This method will be removed in a future release. Consider switching to Publisher.publishAndSubscribeOn(Executor) and/or using Executor.execute(Runnable) for offloading.

    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Single.idleTimeout​(long, TimeUnit)
    Use Single.timeout(long, TimeUnit).
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Single.publishAndSubscribeOn​(Executor)
    This operator has been deprecated because of upcoming behavior changes in how offloading via operators is done. Originally offloading for subscribe/subscription was applied at the "bottom" of chain (logically the last operator in the chain closest to the subscriber), and offloading for subscriber was applied at the "top" of the operator chain (logically the first operator in the chain after the async source). The current offloading doesn't respect the order in which the operators are applied, the offloading is the same regardless of where the operators are placed in the chain. However, this behavior will soon change to instead respect operator placement order and apply offloading exactly where the offloading operators are applied in the chain. This change in behavior means that it no longer makes sense to fuse the offloading of publish and subscribe as the location of the operators in the chain will now be significant. Publish and subscribe offloading, when required, will typically be placed in different locations. Use separate, appropriately placed, Single.subscribeOn(Executor) and Single.publishOn(Executor) operators instead.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Single.publishAndSubscribeOnOverride​(Executor)
    This method will be removed in a future release. Consider switching to Single.publishAndSubscribeOn(Executor) and/or using Executor.execute(Runnable) for offloading.
    io.servicetalk.concurrent.api.Single.publishOnOverride​(Executor)
    This method will be removed in a future release. Consider switching to Single.publishOn(Executor) and/or using Executor.execute(Runnable) for offloading.

    This method will be removed in a future release. Consider switching to Single.subscribeOn(Executor) and/or using Executor.execute(Runnable) for offloading.

    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientBuilder.doAppendHttpClientFilter​(StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory)
    Users of this API should call GrpcClientBuilder.initializeHttp(HttpInitializer) and use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter(StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) on the builder instance by implementing GrpcClientBuilder.HttpInitializer.initialize(SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder) functional interface.

    Please note: this method used to be abstract - keep the overridden implementation during transition phase.

    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientFactory.appendClientFilter​(FilterFactory)
    gRPC Client Filters will be removed in future release of ServiceTalk. We encourage the use of StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory and if the access to the decoded payload is necessary, then performing that logic can be done in the particular client implementation. Please use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter( io.servicetalk.http.api.StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) upon the builder obtained using GrpcClientBuilder.initializeHttp(GrpcClientBuilder.HttpInitializer) if HTTP filters are acceptable in your use case.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientFactory.appendClientFilterFactory​(FilterFactory, FilterFactory)
    gRPC Client Filters will be removed in future release of ServiceTalk. We encourage the use of StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory and if the access to the decoded payload is necessary, then performing that logic can be done in the particular client implementation. Please use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter( io.servicetalk.http.api.StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) upon the builder obtained using GrpcClientBuilder.initializeHttp(GrpcClientBuilder.HttpInitializer) if HTTP filters are acceptable in your use case.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientFactory.newClient​(FilterableClient)
    gRPC Client Filters will be removed in future release of ServiceTalk. We encourage the use of StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory and if the access to the decoded payload is necessary, then performing that logic can be done in the particular client implementation. Please use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter( io.servicetalk.http.api.StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) upon the builder obtained using GrpcClientBuilder.initializeHttp(GrpcClientBuilder.HttpInitializer) if HTTP filters are acceptable in your use case.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcClientFactory.newFilter​(Client, FilterFactory)
    gRPC Client Filters will be removed in future release of ServiceTalk. We encourage the use of StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory and if the access to the decoded payload is necessary, then performing that logic can be done in the particular client implementation. Please use SingleAddressHttpClientBuilder.appendClientFilter( io.servicetalk.http.api.StreamingHttpClientFilterFactory) upon the builder obtained using GrpcClientBuilder.initializeHttp(GrpcClientBuilder.HttpInitializer) if HTTP filters are acceptable in your use case.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcExecutionStrategies.Builder.executor​(Executor)
    Set the executor to use on the ExecutionContext using executor(Executor) methods on client/server builders.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcExecutionStrategies.Builder.offloadWithThreadAffinity()
    Use a single threaded executor set on ExecutionContext using executor(Executor) methods on client/server builders to ensure affinity.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcExecutionStrategies.defaultStrategy​(Executor)
    Set the executor to use on the ExecutionContext using executor(Executor) methods on client/server builders.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcExecutionStrategies.noOffloadsStrategy()
    Replaced with the more descriptive GrpcExecutionStrategies.offloadNever().
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcServerBuilder.appendCatchAllFilter​(HttpServerBuilder)
    This method was introduced temporarily, should not be used, and will be removed in version 0.42.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcServerBuilder.appendConnectionAcceptorFilter​(ConnectionAcceptorFactory)
    Call GrpcServerBuilder.initializeHttp(HttpInitializer) and use HttpServerBuilder.appendConnectionAcceptorFilter(ConnectionAcceptorFactory) on the builder instance by implementing GrpcServerBuilder.HttpInitializer.initialize(HttpServerBuilder) functional interface.
    io.servicetalk.grpc.api.GrpcServerBuilder.appendHttpServiceFilter​(StreamingHttpServiceFilterFactory)
    Call GrpcServerBuilder.initializeHttp(HttpInitializer) and use HttpServerBuilder.appendServiceFilter(StreamingHttpServiceFilterFactory) on the builder instance by implementing GrpcServerBuilder.HttpInitializer.initialize(HttpServerBuilder) functional interface.

    io.servicetalk.loadbalancer.RoundRobinLoadBalancerFactory.Builder.eagerConnectionShutdown​(boolean)
    To control the behaviour, configure the ServiceDiscoverer of your choice to deliver appropriate ServiceDiscovererEvent.status(). In order to avoid connection shutdown use ServiceDiscovererEvent.Status.EXPIRED. Use ServiceDiscovererEvent.Status.UNAVAILABLE when the connections should be eagerly closed upon such event.

    Use UdpReporter.Builder.enableWireLogging(String, LogLevel, BooleanSupplier) instead.
    io.servicetalk.tcp.netty.internal.ReadOnlyTcpServerConfig.backlog()
    Use ReadOnlyTcpServerConfig.listenOptions() with key ServiceTalkSocketOptions.SO_BACKLOG.
    io.servicetalk.tcp.netty.internal.TcpServerConfig.backlog​(int)
    Use TcpServerConfig.listenSocketOption(SocketOption, Object) with ServiceTalkSocketOptions.SO_BACKLOG.
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ClientSslConfigBuilder.disableHostnameVerification()
    Disabling hostname verification may leave you vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks. See server identity on the risks of disabling. If the expected value isn't automatically inferred use ClientSslConfigBuilder.peerHost(String) to set the expected value. When disabling is intended, use ClientSslConfigBuilder.hostnameVerificationAlgorithm with "" as argument.
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ConnectionObserver.ReadObserver.itemRead()
    Use ConnectionObserver.ReadObserver.itemRead(Object)
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ConnectionObserver.WriteObserver.itemReceived()
    Use {ConnectionObserver.WriteObserver.itemReceived(Object)}
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ConnectionObserver.WriteObserver.itemWritten()
    Use ConnectionObserver.WriteObserver.itemWritten(Object)
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ExecutionStrategy.executor()
    The Executor from the ExecutionContext should be used instead.
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ExecutionStrategy.offloadReceive​(Executor, Single<T>)
    This method will be removed. If you depend upon it consider copying the implementation from DefaultHttpExecutionStrategy#offloadReceive()
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.ExecutionStrategy.offloadSend​(Executor, Single<T>)
    This method will be removed. If you depend upon it consider copying the implementation from DefaultHttpExecutionStrategy#offloadSend()
    io.servicetalk.transport.api.TransportObserver.onNewConnection()
    Use TransportObserver.onNewConnection(Object, Object)
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.BuilderUtils.useEpoll​(EventLoopGroup)
    Use NativeTransportUtils.useEpoll(EventLoopGroup)
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.BuilderUtils.useKQueue​(EventLoopGroup)
    Use NativeTransportUtils.useKQueue(EventLoopGroup)
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.NettyIoExecutors.createEventLoopGroup​(int, ThreadFactory)
    Use EventLoopAwareNettyIoExecutors.toEventLoopAwareNettyIoExecutor(IoExecutor) and EventLoopAwareNettyIoExecutor.eventLoopGroup() with any NettyIoExecutor created by other factory methods in this class.
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.internal.NettyIoExecutors.createIoExecutor​(ThreadFactory)
    Use NettyIoExecutors.createIoExecutor(IoThreadFactory).
    io.servicetalk.transport.netty.NettyIoExecutors.createIoExecutor​(int, ThreadFactory)
    Use NettyIoExecutors.createIoExecutor(int, IoThreadFactory).
